intro: Diplazium morii, commonly known as the mountain fern, is a species of fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bipinnate fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The botanical features of Diplazium morii make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
